title: House Democrats Release Epstein’s Birthday Letter Apparently Signed by Trump
summary: The Oversight Committee released files turned over by Jeffrey Epstein’s estate, including a copy of a sexually suggestive note apparently signed by President Trump.

title: In Epstein’s ‘Birthday Book,’ a Celebration of His Lecherous Exploits
summary: The book containing 50th birthday tributes to Jeffrey Epstein was released on Monday by the House Oversight Committee.

title: Trump Denies Epstein Birthday Drawing, but Signature Matches Personal Letters
summary: Donald Trump’s signature has evolved over the years, but when signing just his first name, he often includes the same flourish at the end.

title: Israel Orders Evacuation of Gaza City, and Congress Releases Epstein Birthday Notes
summary: Plus, the fight for control of Fox News.

title: Trump Administration Halts I.R.S. Crackdown on Major Tax Shelters
summary: The Treasury Department is rolling back efforts to shut down aggressive strategies used by America’s biggest multinational companies and wealthiest people.

title: Trump Administration Quietly Seeks to Build National Voter Roll Using State Data
summary: In a quest to bolster a long-running claim from President Trump concerning undocumented immigrants illegally voting, the Justice Department is seeking detailed voter roll data from over 30 states.

title: Trump’s Treasury Secretary Threatens to Punch Housing Official in the Face
summary: The dust-up, at a members-only club in Georgetown, was not the first time Scott Bessent has shown a hot temper.

title: Thune Moves to Speed Trump Nominees Past Democratic Blockade
summary: Republicans said the maneuver to change the Senate’s rules, the latest step that would weaken the filibuster, was necessary to overcome Democratic obstruction of President Trump’s nominees.

title: 12th Grade Reading Skills Hit a New Low
summary: High school seniors had the worst reading scores since 1992 on a national test, a loss probably related to increases in screen time and the pandemic. Their math scores fell as well.

title: Israel Orders Total Evacuation of Gaza City, Threatening Full Invasion
summary: Hundreds of thousands will have to decide whether to risk staying put or fleeing to ruined and overcrowded areas in the south as Israel looks set to launch an operation to take over the entire city.

title: Gaza-Bound Flotilla Struck by Drone in Tunisia, Aid Group Says
summary: Officials in Tunisia said there was no evidence of an attack on the ship, which the Global Sumud Flotilla hoped to use to bring humanitarian goods to Gaza.

title: Who Is Lachlan Murdoch, the Media Prince Who Would Be King
summary: A new deal gives him control of his family’s media empire, including Fox News, for probably decades to come.

title: Lachlan Murdoch Secures Control of Fox and News Corp, Ending Succession Fight
summary: Lachlan Murdoch will take control of a new family trust in a deal worth $3.3 billion, ensuring that his father’s media empire will retain its conservative slant.

title: Mamdani Holds Huge Lead in Mayor’s Race, Times/Siena Poll Finds
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee in the New York City mayoral race, is way ahead of his three rivals, but his lead would diminish considerably if the field shrank to a two-man race.

title: Wealthy N.Y. Developers Call Meeting to Plot Mamdani’s Defeat
summary: Some of New York’s largest landlords will convene on Tuesday morning for an urgent gathering to support former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, saying the “time to act is now.”

title: The Forces Behind Nepal’s Explosive Gen Z Protests: What to Know
summary: It was a recent ban on social media that brought young people to the streets, but they came filled with grievances that have built up over years.

title: Get to Know Chicago’s Immigrant Community, Target of Trump’s Crackdown
summary: Almost 40 percent of immigrants living in Chicago are from Mexico. More than 800,000 of the city’s 2.7 million residents identify as Hispanic or Latino.

title: France’s Government Has Collapsed. What Comes Next?
summary: President Emmanuel Macron is expected to appoint a new prime minister, rejecting calls for elections or his resignation.

title: Nuclear Sites Dotted Across Ukraine Pose Threat of Radiation Disaster
summary: Each day of war risks a strike on sites that could scatter radioactive material. Officials say one laboratory near the front has been hit dozens of times.

title: Russian Bomb Kills at Least 20 Picking Up Pensions, Zelensky Says
summary: The Ukrainian leader said that the strike on older people in a Donetsk village should prompt a global response.

title: Nvidia Accuses Rivals of Being A.I. Doomers as US Debates Sale of Chips to China
summary: Rankling national security experts, the chipmaker has stepped up attacks on lawmakers who are pushing restrictions.

title: ASML to Invest $1.5 Billion in Mistral, the French A.I. Start-Up
summary: ASML, the Dutch maker of semiconductor equipment, is investing about $1.5 billion in Mistral, the French A.I. start-up.

title: How New York Police Officers Avoid Drunk Driving Charges
summary: Officers in New York State crashed their official vehicles, hit other motorists and arrived to work reeking of alcohol. And yet, they sometimes evaded criminal punishment, an investigation found.

title: How We Obtained 10,000 Police Disciplinary Records
summary: The New York Times and New York Focus gathered thousands of files from around half of New York State’s nearly 500 law enforcement agencies.

title: Stop Calling It the Trump Era
summary: The compulsion to zero in on the president keeps us from understanding the era fully, and from glimpsing what it might become.

title: How MAHA Influencers Spread Conspiracies About Health Care
summary: How does MAHA turn some health-conscious people against all health care? We found out.

title: How States are Clashing on Abortion
summary: We explain the latest fight over reproductive rights.

title: Late Night Misses the Defense Department Already
summary: President Trump has renamed it the Department of War, “which is what people call the clearance section at TJ Maxx,” Jimmy Fallon said.

title: Firefighters Race to Save a Treasured Sequoia Grove in California
summary: Giant sequoias can live for thousands of years, but wildfires have killed staggering numbers of the trees in recent years.

title: Is America Ready for Japanese-Style 7-Elevens?
summary: Stephen Dacus, head of the chain’s parent company, aims to export its success in Japan, with signature offerings like fresh prepared food.

title: Missouri House Set to Vote on Map That Boosts Republicans
summary: Republicans want to redraw congressional districts and increase their party’s chances of flipping a seat long held by a Democrat in the Kansas City area.

title: Thai Court Orders Thaksin, Ex-Premier, to Serve a Year in Prison
summary: The Supreme Court’s ruling, stemming from past convictions on charges of corruption and abuse of power, was the latest blow to Thaksin Shinawatra.
